title: Starbucks Lit on Fire as Hong Kong Anti-Mask Law Protests Turn Violent
text:
A branch of Starbucks was among a number of Hong Kong businesses attacked on Friday, October 4, as protesters lashed out against a ban on wearing masks in public scheduled to come into effect at midnight.

Large groups of demonstrators occupied roads and caused damaged throughout the city, prompting businesses and shopping centers to close, and the suspension of all MTR services, according to the South China Morning Post.

Soon after, protesters began vandalizing various MTR stations, billboards, and businesses. Many of the business were connected to mainland China, including a restaurant, Bank of China branches, a China Construction Bank branch, and a travel agency, the Post reported.

This footage shows a fire inside a Starbucks on Hennessy Road in the city’s Wan Chai neighborhood. Credit: @yushu48466542 via Storyful
